ErrorSource.description: An object containing references to the source of an error.

pointer.description:
A JSON Pointer which describes which property in the request object to which an error
message relates.

For more details on JSON pointers see [RFC6901](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

location.description:
Describes the location of the data to which the error message is related.

- **"REQUEST"** - Indicates the message relates to a _property_ within the request
  object. The `pointer` property should be populated in this case.
- **"QUERY"** - Indicates the message relates to a _query_ parameter. The `parameter`
  property should be populated in this case.
- **"ID"** - Indicates the message relates to the identifier of the REST resource. The
  `parameter` property _may optionally_ be populated in this case.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

Error.description: An object containing the details of a particular error.

id.description: A unique identifier for the error occurrence, to provide traceability in application logs.

code.description: A provider-specific or enterprise defined error code. Codes must be in uppercase.

detail.description: A provider-specific or enterprise defined error message.

helpUrl.description: A URL which leads to further details about the error (e.g. A help page).

helpText.description: Help text which can provide further assistance on the error.

ErrorsResponseSchema.description: The response returned when one or more errors have been encountered.

enableForABNs.description: Enable for the ABNs listed, ignored if enableForAll is set

disableForABNs.description: Disable for the ABNs listed, takes the precedence over enableForAll

GenericErrorResponse.description:
One or more error(s) were encountered processing the request.

This response contains a collection of errors encountered while processing the request.

ValidationErrorResponse.description:
One or more error(s) were encountered processing the request.

This response contains a collection of errors encountered while processing the request.

BadRequestErrorResponse.description:
The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

The client **SHOULD NOT** repeat the request without modifications.

AuthorizationErrorResponse.description:
Client Error - Unauthorized.

Missing or invalid `Authorization` header.

ForbiddenErrorResponse.description:
Client Error - Forbidden.

Operation not allowed.

ResourceNotFoundErrorResponse.description:
The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. 

Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

MethodNotAllowedErrorResponse.description:
Client Error - Method Not Allowed.

A request method (**GET**, **POST**, **DELETE**, etc) is not supported for the requested
resource.

RequestTimeoutErrorResponse.description:
Client Error - Request Timeout.

The server timed out waiting for the client request.

UnsupportedMediaTypeErrorResponse.description:
Client Error - Unsupported Media Type.

The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support.

TooManyRequestsErrorResponse.description:
Client Error - To Many Requests.

The client has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

InternalServerErrorResponse.description:
Server Error - Internal Server Error. 

A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered while the server
was processing the request.

NotImplementedErrorResponse.description:
Server Error - Not Implemented. 

The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfill
the request. 

Usually this implies future availability (e.g. A new feature of a web-service API).

ErrorResponseExample.description:
An example of an ERROR (`500`) error.

This can be returned when the **API** encounters an internal error.

NotFoundErrorExample.description:
An example of a NOT FOUND (`404`) error.

This can be returned when a **GET** / **PUT** / **DELETE** request is made for a resource
that does not exist.

BadRequestErrorExample.description:
An example of a NOT UNDERSTOOD / BAD REQUEST (`400`) error.

This can be returned when a **API** call is made with malformed syntax.

AuthorizationErrorExample.description:
An example of an AUTHORIZATION (`401`) error.

This can be returned when an **API** call does not contain an `Authorization`
header.

ForbiddenErrorExample.description:
An example of a FORBIDDEN (`403`) error.

This can be returned when an **API** submission is not permitted for a client with
a given `Authorization` header.

MethodNotAllowedErrorExample.description:
An example of a METHOD NOT ALLOWED (`405`) error.

This can be returned when **GET** / **POST** / ** PUT** / **DELETE** request for is made for
a resource that does not support **GET** / **POST** / ** PUT** / **DELETE**.
